innit.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: used as a way of saying ‘isn’t it’
innit.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: used after a statement for emphasis, instead of any question tag. This use is very non-standard and is grammatically incorrect, but has become common in spoken English among some young people
innit.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: He’s a bad man, innit  (=used instead of ‘isn’t he’).
